response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (18 years old)", "high", "Youth is often associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to developmental factors and life transitions."],
    ["Gender (male)", "high", "Males statistically show higher rates of re-arrest and recidivism compared to females."],
    ["Race (Black)", "medium", "While race alone is not a predictor, systemic and societal factors may contribute to differential treatment and outcomes."],
    ["Criminal history (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate exposure to the criminal justice system, moderately increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Physical attributes (6ft, 145 lbs)", "low", "Height and weight are not typically associated with recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital status/living situation (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Living alone and lack of stable family support can contribute to a higher risk factor."],
    ["Educational attainment (no high school diploma/GED, not enrolled in college)", "high", "Low educational attainment is a strong risk factor associated with fewer economic opportunities and higher recidivism."],
    ["Employment history (held 2 jobs during the year)", "medium", "Limited employment stability can contribute to economic and social stressors increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance use (marijuana use in past 4 years)", "medium", "Substance use can impair judgment and contribute to criminal behavior, though the risk level for marijuana is moderate."],
    ["Mental health (periods of feeling down, depressed mood)", "medium", "Symptoms of depression can destabilize behavior and increase vulnerability to recidivism if untreated."],
    ["Family upbringing (lived with biological mother, household size 4, urban area)", "medium", "Growing up in an urban environment can expose individuals to higher crime rates and stress, moderately affecting recidivism risk."],
    ["Religious beliefs (belief in God's influence)", "low", "A belief in divine influence may provide personal support and reduce risk behaviors, thereby lowering recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
